meanings.definition: To partially cook food by boiling it briefly.
meanings.sent1: I will parboil the vegetables before roasting them.
meanings.sent2: It is important to parboil the pasta before adding it to the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally parboiled the broccoli for too long, making it mushy.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm threatened to parboil our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The sun's intense heat seemed to parboil the pavement.

meanings.sent1: The recipe called for adding parboil to the stew.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served parboil as a side dish.
meanings.sent3: The children found the parboil in the fridge and thought it was a strange snack.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the parboil filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The market had a special on parboil, so I bought some to try.
